solution_line_template: The whole family consists of {num_kids} + {num_parents} + {num_grandmothers} = <<{num_kids}+{num_parents}+{num_grandmothers}={total_persons}>>{total_persons} persons.

The entrance ticket to the park costs the same for every person, so the family would need to pay {total_persons} * {entrance_ticket_price} = $<<{total_persons}*{entrance_ticket_price}={entrance_total}>>{entrance_total} to enter.
For visiting the attraction the tickets would cost {num_kids} * {attraction_ticket_kid} = $<<{num_kids}*{attraction_ticket_kid}={attraction_kids_total}>>{attraction_kids_total} for the kids.
Their parents and grandmother would need to pay {num_adults} * {attraction_ticket_adult} = $<<{num_adults}*{attraction_ticket_adult}={attraction_adults_total}>>{attraction_adults_total}.

That means a total cost for the family standing at {entrance_total} + {attraction_kids_total} + {attraction_adults_total} = $<<{entrance_total}+{attraction_kids_total}+{attraction_adults_total}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
